snippet: A rare attack against a senior official of the Independent Election Commission is seen as an indicator of the insurgents’ intent to disrupt the vote next year.
abstract: Taliban kill senior Afghan election official Mohammad Amanulla and then boast about it on Twitter, in what officials say is indicator of insurgents' intent to disrupt 2014 election.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JAWAD SUKHANYAR
byline.contributor: An Afghan employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Kunduz, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: A rare attack against a senior official of the Independent Election Commission is seen as an indicator of the insurgents’ intent to disrupt the vote next year.

headline.main: Taliban Kill Afghan Election Official, Then Brag on Twitter
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan: Taliban Kill Official, Then Brag on Web
